items.title: How do you know if your vote is counted? Sign up for BallotTrax...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

How do you know if your vote is counted? Sign up for BallotTrax to get email or text updates on the status of your voted ballot, including when it's received and processed. Sign up at https://colorado.ballottrax.net/voter/

Visit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information

items.title: If you are notified that your ballot was rejected due to a...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

If you are notified that your ballot was rejected due to a discrepancy in your signature, you can now easily fix it over text. Secretary of State, Jena Griswold, announced that Colorado will offer a new TXT2Cure program. Just text "Colorado" to 2VOTE (28683), and you will receive instructions on how to cure your ballot.

For more info, read this article from the Secretary of State:
https://www.sos.state.co.us/…/…/2020/PR20201007TXT2Cure.html

Visit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information

items.title: If you're visiting a polling place in person this election,...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

If you're visiting a polling place in person this election, please remember that clothing and accessories with political messages on them are not allowed. This includes pins, t-shirts, hats, or other apparel that display a candidate or any issue on the ballot.

You have the right to vote free of intimidation or coercion.

More info and rules about voting in this year's election: https://www.sos.state.co.us/…/elec…/FAQs/crimesRulesFAQ.html

Visit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information

items.title: Every vote is power. We believe everyone deserves a voice that...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Every vote is power. We believe everyone deserves a voice that is equal, protected and heard. What are you voting for this election?

items.title: The ACLU of Colorado believes that the right of free speech...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

The ACLU of Colorado believes that the right of free speech includes your right, at your own home, to post a sign or fly a flag that expresses your views. We are investigating complaints that HOAs have objected when residents have displayed pride flags or Black Lives Matter yard signs.

Has your homeowners association (HOA) or Metro District sent you a recent violation letter or threatened a fine because you were flying a certain flag or posted a certain sign in your yard? ... If you believe your HOA or Metro District is infringing on your right of free expression, please contact the ACLU of Colorado at HOAfreespeech@aclu-co.org.

In your email, please let us know:
• The name of your subdivision, HOA, or metro district;
• What flag or sign your HOA or Metro District objected to; and
• The reason they provided for that objection.

Please also provide us with any violation letter or notice that you received, as well as your contact information.

For more information go to: https://aclu-co.org/hoa-infringement-your-rights-regarding…/

See More

items.title: Today is the last day to return your ballot by mail. Use two...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Today is the last day to return your ballot by mail. Use two stamps and sign-up for BallotTrax to get updates on when your ballot is received and processed: https://colorado.ballottrax.net/voter/

If you miss this deadline simply use a 24 hour, secure drop box instead: https://justvotecolorado.org/

Visit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information

items.title: Voting has come a long way in our country, but it's not...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Voting has come a long way in our country, but it's not time to relax yet. We still have a lot of work ahead of us to make sure that voting is safe, equitable and accurately represents our population.

Visit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information

items.title: Happy Vote Early Day! Ensure that your vote is counted while...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Happy Vote Early Day! Ensure that your vote is counted while keeping your neighbors safe by voting early. Coloradans can vote by drop box or, in some counties, drive-through. Find a location in your county today: https://justvotecolorado.org/

Visit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information

items.title: The deadline to return your ballot by USPS is approaching....
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

The deadline to return your ballot by USPS is approaching. October 26 is the last day to return your ballot by mail, remember to use two stamps. If you miss this deadline simply use a 24 hour, secure drop box instead. You can also sign up for BallotTrax to get updates on when your ballot is received and processed: https://colorado.ballottrax.net/voter/

Visit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information

items.title: Coloradans may collect and return up to 10 ballots each general...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Coloradans may collect and return up to 10 ballots each general election cycle. Ballots must be returned to a drop box the same day they are collected. For more info, visit GoVoteColorado.gov

Visit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information

items.title: “What we’re really focusing on in terms of preserving the...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

“What we’re really focusing on in terms of preserving the right to vote is being able to cut through the noise and provide clear and accurate information,” said Jen Samano, campaign coordinator for the American Civil Liberties Union of Colorado. “Average voters will consume national-level media and might not realize the ins and outs of local election administration.”

People with felony convictions are still not allowed to vote.

publicintegrity.org

Colorado's voting laws are a model for other states looking to expand access – Center for Public Integrity

People with felony convictions are still not allowed to vote.People with felony convictions are still not allowed to vote.

items.title: A Supreme Court Justice will shape civil liberties for...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

A Supreme Court Justice will shape civil liberties for generations. Rushing the nomination process threatens the legitimacy of the Court. Urge Senator Cory Gardner to delay the nomination until after the inauguration: https://bit.ly/3mebtL2

items.title: Join us today at noon and learn how to mobilize around a clear...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Join us today at noon and learn how to mobilize around a clear vision of community safety by addressing solutions that move away from policing of our neighbors. https://go.peoplepower.org/event/action/22710…

items.title: Locking up people experiencing poverty, mental illness or...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Locking up people experiencing poverty, mental illness or addiction benefits no one. COVID-19 has made it clear, Colorado can safely cut dangerous jail and prison populations, save taxpayer money and treat everyone equally. Community over cages.

For decades, Colorado has ruined lives and wasted billions of tax dollars by not modernizing incarceration guidelines for state jails and prisons. The pandemic has show we can make those changes now.

sentinelcolorado.com

EDITORIAL: The region’s free, get-out-of-jail card — courtesy of the coronavirus - Sentinel Colorado

For decades, Colorado has ruined lives and wasted billions of tax dollars by not modernizing incarceration guidelines for state jails and prisons. The pandemic has show we can make those changes now.For decades, Colorado has ruined lives and wasted billions of tax dollars by not modernizing incarceration guidelines for state jails and prisons. The pandemic has show we can make those changes now.

items.title: Amendment 76 is an issue of voter suppression. It was brought to...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Amendment 76 is an issue of voter suppression. It was brought to our ballot by a Florida-based organization intending to push their anti-immigrant agenda in Colorado while disenfranchising our newly empowered 17 year-olds.

If passed, it would take away the right for 17 year-olds to vote in primary elections — a law passed last year which gave voter access to nearly 24,000 17-year-old voters. Amendment 76 is intentionally deceptive and has no place in our state. Vote #NoOn76

Visit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information

items.title: Awarding our electoral college votes to the winner of the...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Awarding our electoral college votes to the winner of the national popular vote in all 50 states will give us a direct voice over the selection of the U.S. President. Every vote will count equally, and the person with the most votes will win every time. Vote #YesOn113

items.title: Nearly everyone will need to take time to care for themselves, a...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Nearly everyone will need to take time to care for themselves, a newborn baby, or a seriously ill family member at some point, but 4 out of 5 Coloradans don’t have access to paid family and medical leave. Proposition 118 will allow Coloradans to put their families first without having to risk losing their job. Vote #YesOn118

items.title: Black, Latinx and Indigenous communities continue to fight...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Black, Latinx and Indigenous communities continue to fight against the use of police violence against their loved ones. To truly feel safe, we must move beyond a system of policing and caging.

Join Campaign Coordinator Jen Samano and Field Organizer Julian Camera on October 22 for the final presentation in this webinar series to discuss how we can mobilize around a clear vision of community safety by addressing solutions that move away from policing of our neighbors. https://go.peoplepower.org/event/action/22710…

items.title: Proposition 115 is an intentionally confusing ballot measure to...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Proposition 115 is an intentionally confusing ballot measure to ban abortion later in pregnancy with no exceptions for health or individual circumstances. Proponents of this ballot measure have said outright they want to force a woman to carry a pregnancy to term — even in cases of rape, risks to the person's health, or a lethal fetal diagnosis.

This one-size-fits-all mandate is being pushed by many of the same politicians and groups who have tried to ban abortion in Colora...do every year for the last decade. It allows politics to dictate personal health decisions that should be made by a pregnant person and their family, in consultation with their doctors.

It does not take into account the unique circumstances each person may face throughout pregnancy. Health needs should drive important medical decisions — not politics.

Help protect Colorado’s access to abortion care and Vote #NoOn115.

See More
